title: Sri Lanka sells 2025 bonds at 22.01-pct, 2027 at 22.16-pct
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka has sold 28 billion rupees of 2025 and 2027 bond at a auction Thursday and opened a window to sell more bonds at the weighted average yield, the state debt office said.
The debt office sold 13.1 billion rupees of 01 June 2025 bonds at 22.01 percent after offering 20 billion rupees.
15 billion rupees of 01 May 2027 bonds were sold at 22.16 percent with all 15 billion rupees of bonds being sold.

The central bank which operates an crisis prone soft-peg or intermediate regime (flexible exchange rate) has triggered around 20 percent of inflation by March 2022 in the course of operating flexible inflation targeting with output gap targeting (stimulus).
More 2025 bonds would be offered on tap at the weighted average yield. (Colombo/Apr29/2022)
